column1: == History ==
Prior to the arrival of the European Spanish Conquistadors
column2: this area was the pre-Columbian kingdom of Zapotlán and was at different times under the domain of the nearby kingdoms of Colima and Michoacán.

column1: Zapotlán el Grande was conquered in 1526. Many treasures and weapons are said to be buried throughout the town's old colonial homes
In the mid-19th century
column2: the name of the town was changed from Zapotlán el Grande to Ciudad Guzmán
column3: after the Mexican federalist insurgent Gordiano de Guzmán.

column1: The town has been nicknamed the "Athens of Jalisco" because it's the birthplace of several well-known intellectuals and artists
column2: including the muralist José Clemente Orozco
column4: the scientist José María Arreola and the journalist and historian Juan José Arreola.

column1: == Climate ==

Ciudad Guzman has a humid subtropical climate (Köppen climate classification Cwa) with distinct dry and wet seasons. The warmest month is June with an average of 23.0 °C (73.4 °F) and the coldest month is January with an average of 15.7 °C (60.3 °F). Average annual precipitation is 717.8 millimetres (28.3 in)
column2: most of it concentrated from June to September and during these months
column3: thunderstorms and cloudy days are common and humidity is higher. In contrast
column4: the dry season has little precipitation and cooler temperatures but the weather can be foggy
column5: especially from October to January. Frosts can occasionally occur on the coldest nights but extended periods of frosts are rare. The record high was 39.0 °C (102.2 °F) on April and again on May 30
